name: Eastern & Oriental Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Eastern & Oriental is the perfect place to relax after a hot and sweaty day sightseeing in Penang. Both built by the Sarkies Brothers, it’s no surprise that the E&O looks just like Singapore’s famous Raffles Hotel. Well we live in Singapore but unfortunately, at SGD640 a night we won’t be staying at Raffles any time soon. The E&O, however, is the next best thing – maybe better - for a fraction of the price. We got a special rate for Singapore residents – RM480 per night.
reviews.title: Raffles Reincarnated
Terrible experience , Very poor customer relations
reviews.text: From looking at the website I was a bit concerned that the place might be pretentious or stuffy but it's really not. Do, however, expect royal treatment all the way. The minute we got through the door, our luggage was whisked away and we were given a chilled mocktail in one of those old fashioned shallow champagne glasses. Check in was all done from the comfort of a chaise longue and we were escorted to our room and shown how to work everything. One small problem – the twin beds weren’t joined together as promised – was quickly solved. A maid appeared in minutes to sort it out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms – wow! We stayed in the most basic room but it was fantastic, with crisp clean linen on the beds, lots of E&O branded pillows and a huge bathroom with his and hers sinks and a rainforest shower. There was even a separate lounge area with sofa, coffee table and writing desk – and a butler call button right next to the bed! The whole hotel has a great colonial throwback feel to it and everything was immaculate.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t eat much in the hotel as we wanted to try out the restaurants on Gurney Drive (try Bali Hai for a good beach-front fish restaurant). The bar food in Farquhar’s bar was good though and breakfast was okay, although the staff were a bit over-zealous in clearing tables when people hadn’t even finished. One day we were seated at a table only for the bewildered looking previous occupants to turn up seconds later, breakfast in hand. The coffee shop wasn’t much to write home about either – I was expecting a bit more than three tiny tables and a few sad looking cakes to tempt me for afternoon tea.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: As previous reviewers have commented, the area immediately outside the hotel is a bit rough around the edges (and I’m not sure which bright spark thought it was a good idea to build a petrol station right opposite). Penang as a whole is great though – yes, there’s the rough with the smooth, but there are some fascinating places to visit and after a hot day pounding the streets, it’s great to return to the sanctuary of the E&O and take a dip in the pool looking out over the ocean.
reviews.title: Praise all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Open since more than 100 years... entering in the lobby you breath history.
reviews.title: Old time charme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very well furnished with old english style but with all modern amenities.
reviews.title: They didn't make a fuss about the smuggled durian!

likes.liked: — The comfortable bed and the gorgeous ensuite
likes.disliked: — Noisy ventilation noise in early morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The huge marble bathroom is simply amazing!
reviews.title: The Outlook Hotel meets 1920s shabby chic

likes.liked: — Private, quiet and like being on the set of The Shining
likes.disliked: — Impersonal service, lack of attention to detail (considering price)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice pool on the oceanfront.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

likes.liked: — Room had a view of the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also very well located with clubs, restaurants and shops within walking distance.
reviews.title: Classic building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand old colonial building built in the days when air-conditioning wasn't available.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Same About Penang

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Huge rooms that are tastefully fitted out. Great sea view (although the sea is somewhat grey and mucky).
reviews.title: Absolutely lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: Helpful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: The Only Place to Stay in Penang

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disappointed with Penang though.
reviews.title: 40th wedding anniversary fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I held our wedding reception at the E&O and stayed there for 2 nights. The experience was nothing short of wonderful. As both of us are non-locals, we only had a small reception for my mum's friends and relatives at Sarkies. We took their "Wine and Dine" buffet which was totally worth it. The food selection was excellent, from cod fish to grilled prawns to sashimi and not forgetting authentic Penang fare. The roast duck is a must try as it was so succulent and tender.
reviews.title: a classic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Simply The best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 nights in Gorge town here before 3 nights in Batu F.
reviews.title: A graceful and elegant lifestyle not to be missed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice - and with kids - very accomodating.
reviews.title: Too good for words!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful pool.
reviews.title: The best hotel I have ever stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value at about 400 Rm a night and room was ample size to fit an extra bed for the 2 kids. Loved it
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room here for 2 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Our room was huge and had a lovely balcony as requested. The staff were really friendly and eager to please at reception.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was nice, although the weather was terrible during our stay so we made little use of it.
reviews.title: Nice to experience some real colonial history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was average and a disappointment. We expected alot from considering this is one of the top hotels around. The buffet selection was not always hot and sometimes soggy.
reviews.title: Whats that smell?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We ate at the bar for lunch though and this was much better, although quite expensive for what you get.
reviews.title: old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we had a very pleasant stay here and many thanks to the staff who organised our anniversary surprise :)
reviews.title: Excellent hotel to spend anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed there for 2 nights at the beginning of our Malaysia trip.
reviews.title: very civilised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was left to ruin after the British had left but was refurbished in 2000. They did a wonderful job! It recreates the colonial feel with huge rooms and bathrooms, tastefully furnished in dark furniture and Victorian style bathtub, his-and-her sinks, just lovely.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant offers a good choice for breakfast and other meals. It was a little too cool for our taste, but you can always take meals outside on the terrace overlooking the sea.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

likes.liked: — The beautiful rooms, high tea, pool, views from the windows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is no beach.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is nice and everyone is offered a glass of iced water when you get there. Check-in was swift and although they had no record of the deposit we had paid that was quickly rectified. We had also arranged a hire car through them and that went very smoothly. We didn't even have to pick up the car from the airport, but they came and dropped off the car at the hotel at no extra cost.
reviews.title: Beautiful decorated hotel

likes.liked: — the room, the bathroom, the balcony

reviews.title: My only regret is I will never experience this opulence ever again!
reviews.text: We checked in on New Year's Day 2011 and the moment we walked through the reception door I knew we were in for a wonderful stay. As we were seated on antique chairs, offered a cold towel and refreshments whilst checking in, we were amazed at the old world charm this hotel had to offer. We were shown to our room and were disappointed to find that it was a twin. Obviously there was some confusion with the online booking system we had used as we would never expect or request it as my husband is very tall and a single bed would never do. The beds pushed together with a mattress on top was offered but we weren't convinced that would be comfortable. As the hotel was nearly fully booked not even an upgrade to the next level could be offered and so reluctantly we said we would find alternative accommodation. The hotel tried very hard to find a solution and eventually offered to place us in their Pinang Suite at a small additional cost. We agreed to have a look and the doors opened to a suite bigger than our house full of antiques and Persian rugs with balconies looking out to the bay, but the best thing was a king size four poster brass bed. YES! I said. Because of the great comfort of our accommodation, good location and friendly and accommodating staff, we would recommend the E&O to anyone. Thank you E&O for making sure we didn't miss this once in a lifetime opportunity.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The balcony room was worth the small extra cost. The rooms are modern and spacious. Penang has a great energy and like Georgetown, this hotel really has character (the good kind). Conveniently located a couple of blocks from a bunch of bars and a hawker centre (called red moon, I think?). We felt way classier than we actually are staying here. Unfortunately, we had to complain to our "butler" a few times to get our room safe fixed, and we had a couple of mysterious bar charges on our bill at check-out which we had to get removed.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Eastern And Oriental Hotel. It really was an oldy-wordly experience. The rooms were very spacious and the cleanliness of the room was fantastic.
reviews.title: Very Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff from the check in and throughout our stay were exemplary. The pool area was small but well shaded and more than adequate for the number of guests who appeared to have used it.
reviews.title: The best hotel in town...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet was generally superb, with a large range of choices. Sitting on the terrace enjoying breakfast was an amazing experience as was the high tea held at around 2pm.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I suggested Penang for our year-end family short trip because of the E & O. I have a soft spot for hotels with some history, or in this case, the much touted "old world charm". I had rather high expectations since I came from the land of the Raffles Hotel, and the E & O was also founded by the Sarkies brothers. The old world charm is there if you look for it purposely, but it isn't s grand as it's S'porean cousin. The cleanliness and service levels are as expected for a 5-star hotel. Our 3 year old son wetted the bed on the first night, and the butler obligingly had it changed during room service. The bathroom was my fav. It evoked an old European flavour and was huge. Our suite overlooked part of the sea but it was super-duper cold (despite adjusting the air-con to 28 degrees). This affected our sleep quite a bit as our kids started getting the sniffles. Location-wise, it is close to a few historical locations such as the Blue Mansion. The pool is not very kids-friendly, though.
reviews.title: Old-World Charm - almost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel offers a service level that is absolutely unparalelled in Georgetown. Staff is extremely friendly, the breakfast buffet is absolutely amazing
reviews.title: Great hotel, an absolute must on à visit to georgetown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment of checking in to departure we were treated like old friends. All the staff were extremely helpful and professional without being intrusive.
reviews.title: A classy hotel of a bygone age with every modern comfort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Standards in the hotel are very high and the quality of the rooms are excellent as has already been stated in previous reviews. The hotel is ideally situated close to all the local heritage sites Georgetown has to offer.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, improvements needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There were always taxi's outside or tricycles for hire all day long.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel & setting, excellent staff and service & highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for 8 nights at the E&O recently. Had a Writer's Suite which was just fantastic. I love this place - not too stuffy but so friendly and unique. Breakfast is great, bar relaxed and hotel so atmospheric. The pool is fantastic. You won't get a pool that is better situated. It's worth staying here for this alone. Our stay in this hotel was a real treat and I can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: A wonderful place and experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at this hotel and found it very comfortable. The room was large with a separate sitting area which we hadn't expected. The design of the rooms is unusual too in that the doors to the rooms aren't all directly off the corridor. The doors to each pair of rooms is set back off another little corridor which seems a good idea to us and helps to keep the noise levels down. The bathroom was big too with 'his & her' wash basins and separate bath and shower cubicle.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel overlooking the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was well kept and relaxing to sit by and overlooks the bay.
reviews.title: Eastern & Oriental, Penang - a hotel like one straight out of a movie!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove to the hotel - it's on a 1 way system and we missed the car park entrance first time round and had to go round again. However it you pull up directly in front of the hotel the valets will park the car for you.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. BUT beware when you stay and which room you get. Avoid peak times!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have you ever been to a hotel that reminds you of one straight out of the movies? I am not talking about one like the Beverly Hills Hilton Hotel nor one like the Regent Beverly Wilshire; both of which was featured in one of my all time favourite movie – Pretty Woman, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts. My question is: why look that far, when we have one right here – in the Pearl of the Orient.
reviews.title: Timeless elegance....like stepping back in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a total colonial throwback and different to all of the other "resort" hotels that are the rage in this part of the world now. Loved taking high tea and breakfast on the verandah - it's like the empire had never ended (and for some of the other residents I suspect it hadn't)!
reviews.title: The Colonial Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff try their best to give you the service you want although the building does provide some limitations insofar as the a/c can't dehumidify the rooms sufficiently without turning them into a refrigerator - and then if you open the windows to warm the room up the mosquitos come in for a feast.
reviews.title: Charming but far from perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The humidity problem does lend itself to making the bedclothes a little damp and the bed itself felt a little more tired (or compressed) than what we are used to. But on balnce the rooms/suites are of an excellent size with everything you need. It was a shame ours (like most) didn't have a balcony but to do so would entail major building work to this grand old lady.
reviews.title: A beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: Location is great for exploring Georgetown and the pool is bijou but superb with enough space for all who wanted it although you do miss the beach (not sure why really when the pool overlooks the sea but that's human nature for you).
reviews.title: One of the finest hotels in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps we should have managed our expectations a little better before we visited the E&O. We love colonial hotels and read some rave reviews comparing the E&O to Raffles (with the obvious linkage via the Sarkies etc.). Having stayed at both, it is very difficult to compare them when it comes to the details. The E&O is, indeed, a beautiful building. We experienced no major problems with service, in fact some aspects, like check-in were remarkable efficient, but we were constantly left with the feeling that there was so much unrealised potential there.
reviews.title: Nostalgi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overrated place living in the past. We stayed here for two nights and recognised some of the other guests here, if you are going high end to penang then you undoubtedly will end up here on recommendation.
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I personally found it to be rather like a Holiday Inn. Mediocre place with the worst bathroom amenities I have ever had. I travelled light with carry ons so I needed a reasonable razor. After 15 minutes of trying to shave I gave up with a minor trim of my stubble....the bathroom products were very poor and obviously the target of some cost-cutting.
reviews.title: Not sure Kipling would approve. Not quite up to snuff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a corner room with no balcony, make sure you ask for one with a balcony. Outside the room there was a guy who would do reflexology it was noisy. It does feel like a Radisson once you are past reception.
reviews.title: Colonial Value
Worst Hotel management without proper CCTV
reviews.text: I really don't want to spend time by reviewing this place, just for your benefit I would say don't bother if you are looking for luxury - in fact there is nothing really to see in Penang so if you are a traveller see some of the other islands, this one just bleeds your vacation time! Oh there is complimentary internet in the business centre so there was one plus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Obviously you're staying in what was once an old colonial hotel and some times this can mean the rooms are now quite dark and huge, as they were designed like that to keep them cool. But the furnishings here are fairly dreadful. Ditto the decor in the communal areas. The hotel needs money spent on it like the mandarin oriental in bangkok or the raffle sin singapore. But then this is only georgetown so I guess you can't expect all that much. But it's not nearly as lovely as say the strand in Yangon. So it could be better. The restaurant is hideous and vast. Always busy, which i found strange, considering the muck they were serving. Horrible vast great stomach churning buffets. The bar is hideous. The service pretty slapdash. Basically it's nothing special, but if you're passing through then a good place for the night. But then I like staying in old colonial hotels and imagining what they must have once been like.
reviews.title: Over rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed the E & O's old world charm and its position in the heart of Geore Town, it is perfect for exploring the older parts of town. Our George Town suite was huge & exellent value. I found the staff very helpfull & friendly.
reviews.title: Very good

likes.disliked: — There was nothing i did not like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were lucky with our booking at the E&O Hotel. When we presented ourselves at the reception desk for our 3 night stay in July 2008 we were politely told that our Straits Suite had been double booked. This news is normally a vacationer's nightmare. But instead of any anguish we were upgraded at no extra cost to a much larger and luxurious Writer's Suite (the Somerset Maugham), about 135sqm of absolute comfort on the first floor of this magnificent 1885 building. This seafront hotel has been refurbished without regard for cost, maintaining its marble and wooden floors, wide passageways and high ceilings. It is visually impressive but functional and comfortable. Our suite consisted of three rooms - a bedroom, large bathroom (with his/her wash basins) and a huge living/dining room. There was one toilet in the bathroom and another in a room off the living room. We had excellent ocean views, and windows which fully opened. Airconditioning was silent and very effective. All staff at the E&O are friendly and obliging, and we were treated to a butler, who was available at the ring of a bell. Breakfasts were in Sarkies Corner, the groundfloor restaurant. All manner of food was available. Guests could sit in the restaurant, or outside on the verandah near the sea wall. We chose to breakfast outdoors, to enjoy the cool morning air and the ambience. Three internet computers were available to guests, and there was no charge for their use. And there is broadband connection to rooms, for guests with their own laptops. For dinner there is a buffet in Sarkies, with a different theme each night. We dined there on the first night of our stay (a Saturday). Whilst the food was extensive and very appetising (all you can eat, with free flow of wine), the restaurant became very congested and noisy, and my wife and I were pleased to have chosen an outside table, on the verandah. The outdoor pool at ground level is clean, cooling and tranquil. I shouldn't forget Farquhers Bar, where I spent a little time. It is a good place for a quiet drink, a pub in colonial Malaya style, just off the lobby. As other advisers have reported the E&O Hotel is in the heart of Georgetown. Getting around on foot or by rickshaw or taxi is very easy, and there is plenty to see and do close to the hotel. For guests who book direct (as we did) and are not on a package, it is worth noting that in addition to a room charge, the E&O imposes a 10% service charge and a further 5% government tax. But don't let that deter you. This is a great hotel.
reviews.title: Nostalgia, with the best of comfort and service

likes.liked: — Our suite, with 135sqm of absolute luxury
likes.disliked: — Some noise and congestion in Sarkies Restaurant during evening buffets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely, Penang's Grande Dame! Old word charm everywhere!
reviews.title: Penang's Grand Dame!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the E&A 3 nights in June. What a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms are very spacious. We had a beautiful balcony/terrace with amazing views of the ocean. The food was excellent, both at breakfast & dinner. Incredible selection of Asian & Western items. They offer a dinner buffet with different themes every night. The seafood, meats, vegetables,cheeses, desserts were amazing. You name it they have it. The staff was very helpful. The hotel's lobbies, grounds, swimming pool were amazing. Free internet use as well. Fresh fruit in the room daily, tea & coffee making facilities, bottled water, as well as excellent bathroom toiletries. Cold water and cool refreshing towels were brought inmediately as you sat at the pool lounging chairs. What a delightful touch!
reviews.title: Oasis of calm

description: The Eastern & Oriental Hotel is the embodiment of both a special time and a special place. For well over a century, this remarkable hotel - known simply as `The E&O' to generations of travellers - has stood as a testament to the grand elegance of the British colonial era.In many ways, it has also come to represent Penang itself; its story inextricably woven into the island's history, its traditions an indelible part of many a traveller's treasured memory, its name synonymous with the magical island once known as The Pearl Of the Orient.
